alert.note: Alert for Chippewa; Mackinac (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 15 at 9:23PM EDT until June 15 at 10:30PM EDT by NWS Gaylord
info.description: The National Weather Service in Gaylord has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Chippewa County in eastern Michigan... Mackinac County in eastern Michigan... * Until 1030 PM EDT. * At 923 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 10 miles northwest of Grand Marais to Gould City to 12 miles west of Saint James On Beaver Island, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Engadine around 930 PM EDT. Naubinway around 935 PM EDT. Gilchrist and Garnet around 940 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Hulbert, Eckerman, Epoufette, Brevort, Strongs, Trout Lake, East Lake, Bayview Campground and Fibre. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM EDT for eastern Michigan. A Tornado Watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, if one is spotted, act quickly and move to a place of safety inside a sturdy structure such as a basement or small interior room. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
